content.description: This fun little warm-up lip traverses a rising seam with the occasional sloper. Begin sitting matched on a sloper jug, and move up the lip about halfway across the boulder until it is possible to do the crux mantel over using a few crimps. Traverse off the the left.
content.location:
Right of

Captains Of The Industry

, it is essentially the only other problem in this little hangout spot.

content.description:
At last, the Leprechaun Project is no more. This thing has been on my mind for over a year now. It’s as good and as scary as they come.

Start standing on a perfect, rounded jug with your feet on the overhang as well. Climb up the beautiful crack feature over the ramp, using a perfectly sculpted crimp along the way. Fingerlocks will get you into the roof, then a terrifying crux followed by a foot first sequence at 20 feet give way to an easier topout.

This thing isn’t for the faint of heart....
content.protection: As many pads as you can get there, which should be a lot since you can run your car into the boulder.
content.location:
It is across the road from Point Break crag site the Leprechaun Overhang - which hosts the singular line. Irish Rolex climbs the obvious and huge overhang above the ramp. It’s also a quarter mile downcanyon from

Dark Waters

.

content.description:
Simply amazing, this incredible line vies for the best mid-level boulder in the canyon. COTI is the striking and very highball face/arete down canyon from New River Wall.

Begin all the way at the bottom of the arete on a pair of crimps at 6 feet. Move up through increasingly difficult terrain with perfect flow to a committing crux move at 20 feet. There are several different methods to do this crux, and all are hard and scary. After the hardest move, continue into the no fall zone using perfectly sculpted holds on the arete and the crack systems on the face. Rock over the lip using a jug block, and stand on the slab. Find a way to cautiously work down the sketchy slab to the left.

With perfect rock, perfect moves, and perfect holds along with a flat landing, Captains is one of the king lines of CCC and should not be missed by anyone who likes to get off the ground.
content.protection: At least 4 pads and a spot. Falling off the top isn’t really an option....
content.location: This along with Loafty are in the zone about 200 yards down canyon and on the hillside part of the road from New River Wall. Park there, and walk down the road to a short scramble up the steep hillsides. The boulder is visible from the road. The approach takes 5 minutes.
